prompt: How many banks were nationalized in the first phase of bank nationalization in India?
explanation: 14 major commercial banks were nationalized on July 19, 1969, under the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970.

prompt: In which year did the second phase of bank nationalization take place in India?
explanation: 6 more banks were nationalized on April 15, 1980, in the second phase of bank nationalization.

prompt: How many banks were nationalized in the second phase (1980) of bank nationalization?
explanation: 6 banks were nationalized in 1980: Andhra Bank, Corporation Bank, New Bank of India, Oriental Bank of Commerce, Punjab & Sind Bank, and Vijaya Bank.

prompt: Which of the following was NOT nationalized in 1969?
explanation: State Bank of India was already a public sector bank (nationalized in 1955 as Imperial Bank of India). The 14 banks nationalized in 1969 did not include SBI.

prompt: Which bank was originally known as the Imperial Bank of India before it became State Bank of India?
explanation: The Imperial Bank of India was formed in 1921 by amalgamating the three Presidency Banks. It was nationalized and renamed State Bank of India in 1955.

prompt: The first bank to be established in India was?
explanation: Bank of Hindustan, established in 1770 in Calcutta, is considered the first bank to be established in India. It closed in 1832.

prompt: Which three Presidency Banks amalgamated to form Imperial Bank of India?
answers: Bank of Bengal, Bank of Bombay, Bank of Madras
Bank of Calcutta, Bank of Delhi, Bank of Madras
explanation: The three Presidency Banks - Bank of Bengal (1806), Bank of Bombay (1840), Bank of Madras (1843) - were amalgamated in 1921 to form Imperial Bank of India.

prompt: Punjab and Sind Bank nationalized in?
explanation: Punjab and Sind Bank was nationalized in 1980.
